sections.title: Canvas Guide
sections.description: Master the infinite canvas and workflow arrangement

sections.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
sections.description: Speed up your workflow with keyboard shortcuts

doc-welcome.title: Welcome to WorkflowUI
doc-welcome.description: An introduction to WorkflowUI and its core concepts

content.content: WorkflowUI is a powerful, visual workflow editor that lets you create, organize, and execute complex workflows with an intuitive infinite canvas interface, similar to Miro or FigJam.

items: Workspaces: Top-level containers for organizing your projects
Projects: Group related workflows together on a shared canvas
Workflows: Individual workflow definitions with nodes and connections
Canvas: Infinite space for arranging workflow cards spatially
Nodes: Building blocks within workflows that perform operations

content.content: New to WorkflowUI? Start with our Getting Started guide to set up your first workspace.

doc-workspace-basics.title: Workspace Basics
doc-workspace-basics.description: Learn how to create and manage workspaces

content.content: A workspace is the top-level container in WorkflowUI. Each workspace can contain multiple projects, each with its own set of workflows arranged on an infinite canvas.
Click on the workspace selector in the header (top-left corner)
Select 'Create New Workspace' from the dropdown menu
Enter a name and optional description
Choose descriptive names for your workspaces (e.g., 'Q1 Projects', 'Client Work', 'Personal')

doc-first-workflow.title: Create Your First Workflow
doc-first-workflow.description: Step-by-step guide to creating your first workflow

content.content: Navigate to a project by selecting it from the sidebar
Click the '+' button in the Projects section to create a new project if needed
Click the '+' button on the canvas to add a new workflow
Give your workflow a name and optional description
Click on the workflow card to open the editor
Pro tip: Use meaningful names and descriptions to help you remember what each workflow does.

doc-canvas-intro.title: Understanding the Canvas
doc-canvas-intro.description: Learn how to navigate and use the infinite canvas

content.content: The canvas is an infinite workspace where you can arrange workflow cards. Unlike traditional list views, the canvas lets you organize workflows spatially, creating visual relationships and workflows.

items: Infinite space: Pan in any direction without limits
Zoom: Use scroll wheel or zoom controls to focus on specific areas
Drag & drop: Move workflow cards to organize them spatially
Grid: Optional grid overlay to help with alignment
Snap to grid: Automatic alignment for precise arrangement

content.content: Use the zoom controls (bottom-right) or your mouse scroll wheel to zoom in and out.

doc-drag-drop.title: Dragging & Resizing Workflow Cards
doc-drag-drop.description: Learn how to drag, resize, and arrange workflow cards on the canvas

content.content: Click and drag any workflow card to move it to a new position on the canvas. Cards will snap to the grid if grid snapping is enabled in settings.
Hover over the edge of a workflow card to reveal resize handles. Drag any handle to resize the card.

items: Hold Shift and click cards to add/remove from selection
Drag to create a selection box around multiple cards
Move all selected cards together by dragging any one of them

content.content: You can move multiple selected cards at once for quick reorganization.

doc-zoom-pan.title: Zoom & Pan Controls
doc-zoom-pan.description: Master zooming and panning the canvas

items: Scroll wheel: Zoom in/out at your current cursor position
Zoom buttons: Use + and - buttons in the zoom toolbar (bottom-right)
Reset zoom: Click the reset button to return to 100%
Zoom range: 10% to 300%
Space + drag: Hold space and drag to pan the canvas
Middle mouse button: Click middle mouse button and drag to pan
Arrow keys: Use arrow keys to pan in cardinal directions

doc-canvas-shortcuts.title: Canvas Keyboard Shortcuts
doc-canvas-shortcuts.description: Quick reference for canvas keyboard shortcuts

content.content: Use Mac Cmd instead of Ctrl on macOS. Shortcuts may vary by system.

doc-workflow-basics.title: Workflow Basics
doc-workflow-basics.description: Learn the fundamentals of creating workflows

content.content: Workflows are automated sequences of operations. Each workflow consists of nodes connected together, with data flowing from one node to the next.

items: Nodes: Individual operations or data transformations
Connections: Links between nodes showing data flow
Inputs: Entry points for data into the workflow
Outputs: Results produced by the workflow

content.content: Open a project from the sidebar
Click the '+' button to add a new workflow card
Click the card to open the workflow editor
Add nodes from the node palette on the left

doc-workflow-nodes.title: Working with Nodes
doc-workflow-nodes.description: Learn how to add, configure, and connect nodes

content.content: Nodes are the building blocks of workflows. Each node performs a specific operation and can be connected to other nodes to create data pipelines.
Browse the node palette on the left side
Drag a node onto the canvas to add it

items: Operation: Mathematical or logical operations
HTTP: Make API calls to external services
Database: Query and manipulate data
Transform: Convert data between formats
Control: Flow control (if/then/loop)
Notification: Send alerts or messages

doc-workflow-execution.title: Executing Workflows
doc-workflow-execution.description: Learn how to run and monitor workflow execution

content.content: Open the workflow in the editor
Click the 'Run' or 'Execute' button in the toolbar
Monitor progress in the execution panel

items: Success: Workflow completed with output
Error: Workflow failed at a specific node
Timeout: Workflow took too long to complete
Cancelled: Workflow was stopped by user

content.content: Check the execution log for detailed information about each node execution.
Click the settings icon in the header (top-right)

items: Workspace name and description
Default workspace for new sessions
Workspace color and icon
Member permissions and roles
Grid visibility: Show or hide the canvas grid
Grid snapping: Automatically snap cards to grid
Grid size: Adjust grid cell size (10-50px)
Grid style: Choose dots or lines
Zoom level: Set default zoom percentage
Pan behavior: Choose pan trigger (space/middle-click)
Card animations: Enable/disable movement animations

content.content: Disable animations if you experience performance issues with large canvases.

items: Workflow execution: Notify when workflows complete
Workflow errors: Alert on workflow failures
Project updates: Notify of project changes
Collaboration: Alerts when others edit your projects
System: Important system and security notifications
In-app: Notifications displayed in the application
Email: Notifications sent via email
Desktop: Browser desktop notifications
Sounds: Audio alerts for important events

doc-editor-shortcuts.title: Workflow Editor Shortcuts
doc-editor-shortcuts.description: Keyboard shortcuts for the workflow editor

content.content: How do I organize my workflows?
Use workspaces for high-level organization (e.g., by project or team), projects within workspaces for grouping related workflows, and arrange cards spatially on the canvas to show relationships.
Yes! Workflows are automatically saved and can be exported as JSON for version control or sharing with team members.
What's the maximum number of nodes in a workflow?
There's no hard limit, but performance may degrade with very large workflows (1000+). Consider breaking large workflows into smaller, reusable sub-workflows.
Can I collaborate with team members?
Yes! Share workspaces and projects with team members, set permissions, and see real-time collaboration features.

items: Check that all required inputs are provided
Verify node connections are valid
Check the browser console for error messages
Try refreshing the page and running again
Disable card animations in canvas settings
Try zooming out to reduce render load
Close other browser tabs/applications
Try using a different browser
Check your internet connection
Verify you have permission to edit the workflow
Try refreshing the page
Check for browser console errors

content.content: If issues persist, contact support or check the documentation for more help.
